intro: Biscutella longifolia subsp. illyrica, commonly known as the Illyrian biscuit plant, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, lanceolate leaves, and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
